getLastScheduledTaskTime().name: getLastScheduledTaskTime()
getLastScheduledTaskTime().documentation:
@return the scheduled time of the last posted task; Duration.ZERO 0 if there is no currently
    scheduled task.

getNextScheduledTaskTime().name: getNextScheduledTaskTime()
getNextScheduledTaskTime().documentation:
@return the scheduled time of the next posted task; Duration.ZERO if there is no currently
    scheduled task.

getScheduler().name: getScheduler()
getScheduler().documentation:
Returns the {@link org.robolectric.util.Scheduler} that is being used to manage the enqueued tasks. This scheduler is managed by the Looper's associated queue.

Only supported for {@link LooperMode.Mode.LEGACY}. @return the {@link org.robolectric.util.Scheduler} that is being used to manage the enqueued tasks.

idle().name: idle()
idle().documentation: Executes all posted tasks scheduled before or at the current time.

idle(long).name: idle(long)

idle(long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit).name: idle(long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)

idleFor(java.time.Duration).name: idleFor(java.time.Duration)
idleFor(java.time.Duration).documentation: A variant of {@link #idleFor(long, TimeUnit)} that accepts a Duration.

idleFor(long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUn.name: idleFor(long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
idleFor(long,java.util.concurrent.TimeUn.documentation:
Advances the system clock by the given time, then executes all posted tasks scheduled before or
at the given time.

idleIfPaused().name: idleIfPaused()
idleIfPaused().documentation:
Helper method to selectively call idle() only if LooperMode is PAUSED.

Intended for backwards compatibility, to avoid changing behavior for tests still using LEGACY LooperMode.

isIdle().name: isIdle()
isIdle().documentation: Returns true if there are no pending tasks scheduled to be executed before current time.

pause().name: pause()
pause().documentation:
Pause the looper.

Has no practical effect for realistic looper, since it is always paused.

pauseLooper(android.os.Looper).name: pauseLooper(android.os.Looper)
pauseLooper(android.os.Looper).documentation:
Pauses execution of tasks posted to the ShadowLegacyLooper. This means that during tests, tasks
sent to the looper will not execute immediately, but will be queued in a way that is similar to
how a real looper works. These queued tasks must be executed explicitly by calling {@link
#runToEndOftasks} or a similar method, otherwise they will not run at all before your test
ends.

@param looper the looper to pause

pauseMainLooper().name: pauseMainLooper()
pauseMainLooper().documentation:
Puts the main ShadowLegacyLooper in an "paused" state.

@see #pauseLooper

post(java.lang.Runnable,long).name: post(java.lang.Runnable,long)

postAtFrontOfQueue(java.lang.Runnable).name: postAtFrontOfQueue(java.lang.Runnable)

reset().name: reset()
reset().documentation: Causes all enqueued tasks to be discarded, and pause state to be reset

resetThreadLoopers().name: resetThreadLoopers()
resetThreadLoopers().documentation: Should not be called directly - Robolectric internal use only.

runOneTask().name: runOneTask()
runOneTask().documentation:
Causes only one of the next {@link Runnable}s that have been scheduled to run while advancing
the clock to its start time. Only one {@link Runnable} will run even if more than one has been
scheduled to run at the same time.

runPaused(java.lang.Runnable).name: runPaused(java.lang.Runnable)
runPaused(java.lang.Runnable).documentation:
Runs the current task with the looper paused.

When LooperMode is PAUSED, this will execute all pending tasks scheduled before the current time.

runToEndOfTasks().name: runToEndOfTasks()
runToEndOfTasks().documentation:
Causes all of the {@link Runnable}s that have been scheduled to run while advancing the clock
to the start time of the last scheduled {@link Runnable}.

runToNextTask().name: runToNextTask()
runToNextTask().documentation:
Causes the next {@link Runnable}(s) that have been scheduled to run while advancing the clock
to its start time. If more than one {@link Runnable} is scheduled to run at this time then they
will all be run.

runUiThreadTasks().name: runUiThreadTasks()
runUiThreadTasks().documentation:
Runs any immediately runnable tasks previously queued on the UI thread, e.g. by {@link android.app.Activity#runOnUiThread(Runnable)} or {@link android.os.AsyncTask#onPostExecute(Object)}.

**Note:** calling this method does not pause or un-pause the scheduler. @see #runUiThreadTasksIncludingDelayedTasks

runUiThreadTasksIncludingDelayedTasks().name: runUiThreadTasksIncludingDelayedTasks()
runUiThreadTasksIncludingDelayedTasks().documentation:
Runs all runnable tasks (pending and future) that have been queued on the UI thread. Such tasks may be queued by e.g. {@link android.app.Activity#runOnUiThread(Runnable)} or {@link android.os.AsyncTask#onPostExecute(Object)}.

**Note:** calling this method does not pause or un-pause the scheduler, however the clock is advanced as future tasks are run. @see #runUiThreadTasks

setPaused(boolean).name: setPaused(boolean)
setPaused(boolean).documentation:
Control the paused state of the Looper.

Not supported for the main Looper in {@link LooperMode.Mode.PAUSED}.

unPause().name: unPause()
unPause().documentation: Not supported for the main Looper in {@link LooperMode.Mode.PAUSED}.

unPauseLooper(android.os.Looper).name: unPauseLooper(android.os.Looper)
unPauseLooper(android.os.Looper).documentation: Puts the shadow looper in an "unpaused" state (this is the default state). This means that during tests, tasks sent to the looper will execute inline, immediately, on the calling (main) thread instead of being queued, in a way similar to how Guava's "DirectExecutorService" works. This is likely not to be what you want: it will cause code to be potentially executed in a different order than how it would execute on the device, and if you are using certain Android APIs (such as view animations) that are non-reentrant, they may not work at all or do unpredictable things. For more information, see this discussion. @param looper the looper to pause

unPauseMainLooper().name: unPauseMainLooper()
unPauseMainLooper().documentation:
Puts the main ShadowLegacyLooper in an "unpaused" state.

@see #unPauseLooper

name: org.robolectric.shadows.ShadowLooper
documentation:
The base shadow API class for controlling Loopers.

It will delegate calls to the appropriate shadow based on the current LooperMode.
